Why the hell did riot still go with the cho buffs.
constantly below 50% winrate, awful vs meta, awful vs every new champ with speed ups (been almost 2 years since vel'koz), mobility creep, one gank kills him all game, this list can go on.
They should've instead fixed his shout. It's wonky as shit.
I swear to god, it either chooses to hit nothing or the range goes more than it should. There is no middle ground with his W

A bit of knowledge for you, since this used to happen with Darius' pull too.

Chogath's W will acquire targets as soon as the button is pushed. If they walk INTO range before the animation finishes, they will take no damage. If they flash/dash out or even become untargetable (Fizz E) they will still take the damage. Since Darius' pull was fixed in this regard, it would be nice to see Chogath's scream fixed as well.

I can't tell you how many times it's ruined my ultimate or caused me to die.

and on the counter side of that killed me when I was at least 200 units past it's range.
Yeah the cone misses at point blank about 50% of the time.
Cho'gath mains cheer at the buffs and cry at the return to perma-banning cho'gath.
I mean, before the juggernauts, I was banning him and Annie left and right. Fuck an AoE knockup + slow with an AoE silence, high as fuck base and scaling ap damage and a fuckin tank
Awesome nerfs on {{champion:45}} , now he cant 1 hit your APC late game, he cant have 1000+ AP at 35mins and he cant stun your entire team for 3 secs, Thx Riot.
Yes I agree. 30 damage from Q and 20 damage from w were the problem :). GJ Riot! Guess we have to get him to old Kassadin ban status before they fix it.

The point of the nerfs, imo, was to make him weaker earlier on in the game. This means that it is harder to begin the snowball. This is supposed to make it so that he cannot kill you easily with limited items early on. This means you have more time to shut him down and make him useless. When you have 500 health at the beginning of a game, 50 damage means a lot to me. Assuming that you were sarcastic, I actually think that they have done a good job nerfing Veig. I'm Silver 4 so I could be terribly wrong, but it's just my 2 cents on the nerfs.

The fraction of damage they shaved off will mean nothing to good veigars. The early level numbers are barely changed, and 20/30 damage won't mean much when you are that level to have them maxed. Veigar's "problem" is that he has infinite scaling. If he doesn't get shut down early, he's going to be a pain in the ass, but just like vayne, if the game goes long enough, and he catches up, it won't matter. IMO to fix Veigar, change the Q passive so that there is diminishing returns, and the stun so it lasts longer if you actually land it right on, but if you run into it, it doesn't last as long.

it will marginally decrease his impact in a mostly invisible way, allowing him to keep his current fantasy fulfillment but decrease his overall oppressiveness. It might not have the instant "YES! I COMPLAINED AND THEY COMPLETELY FUCKING GUTTED HIM, MY OPINION MATTERS!" feeling to it, but it will bring him into a healthier place.

Forgot the Kappa

oh good, {{champion:45}}  is getting a [-20 base dmg] nerf, now instead of hitting u for 1500dmg in one shot he can only hit u for 1480dmg.  what does nerfing his base dmg <late game do to his late game?  Hell u could give his all his spells 0 base dmg and they would still hit for over 1k come 35 minutes.

Remember that, at the start of the match, Veigar needs to calculate his Q's so that he can last hit to gain the AP to be able to hit for 1480 damage. 

This nerf in base damage is primarily for earlier levels, when he needs to farm up AP for damage.  He will be hitting champions for less damage in the early game, which allows them to be able to shut him down easier.
IS THAT A SHORT JOKE??!! (And the "towers above" part, I see what you did there Rito ;) {{champion:45}}

Shared splash arts for 1350 skins (and a 975) again...

Three skins...

Nunu isn't even in focus. You'd almost not even know he was part of the splash if you didn't know any better.
if you click the "zombie Nunu" it will flip the splash and draw focus towards nunu instead of jinx

I'm a little confused about the changes to Zilean's Q. They attach from edge-to-edge instead of center-to-center? Does that mean that landing the double bomb stun will be much easier now? I assume that they still prioritize enemy champions and units with a bomb already on them, so...

I'm just wondering how I should change my playstyle as Zilean to roll with these changes.

It means the radius to attach is effectively larger.

Right now it was center to center, so a large champ like cho walking by your bomb wouldn't attach to it unless the center of his champ was close enough.

Now a large champion walking by will attach if any part of their hit box does.
omg bring riven edge already
i think they removed that
